citeinfo.title: Land Use: U.S. Geological Survey GAGES-II time series data update

descript.abstract: This dataset consists of eight tables with information regarding land cover/use for the conterminous United States sites of the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Geospatial Attributes of Gages for Evaluating Streamflow II (GAGES-II) dataset. The data include land use variables from two different data sources: from the National Land Cover Dataset (NLCD) for 2001-2011 (every five years) and from the NAWQA Wall-to-wall Anthropogenic Landuse Trends (NWALT) dataset for 1974-2012 (every ten years).
descript.purpose: These data are intended as support for research efforts using the USGS GAGES-II sites.
descript.supplinf: This dataset is in support of study sites in the GAGES-II dataset (Falcone, 2011) and based on the watershed boundaries published there. Information is provided from two separate sources which might have different uses depending on the research goal. The information in the NLCD as compared to the NWALT is similar in some ways, and differs in other ways. The NLCD has a mix of land use information (how humans use the land), and land cover conditions. The NWALT is more strictly a land use dataset, and for example, classifies urban lands by how they are used (residential, commercial, industrial, and so on), and has additional information about agricultural and mining uses. It omits however land cover information, for example, does not include "forest" or "shrubland" as classes. There are both potentially useful for different applications. The calculations from the NWALT given here are from the "Enhanced Grazing Potential" version of the NWALT (Falcone, 2016), which is a slight addition to the original published version (Falcone, 2015). The sole difference between the two versions is the addition of a further Grazing Potential class (class 46) to the 2016 dataset, and are otherwise identical. The complete description of the NWALT classes is given in Falcone, 2015. Class 42 of the NWALT is a placeholder for future use, and is intentionally not populated. All NLCD data are derived from the October 2014 harmonized versions of the NLCD 2001, 2006, 2011 (mrlc.gov). The stated USGS preferred citations for NLCD products are: NLCD 2001 products: Homer and others, 2007. NLCD 2006 products: Fry and others, 2011 NLCD 2011 products: Homer and others, 2015. References: Falcone, J.A., 2011, GAGES-II: Geospatial Attributes of Gages for Evaluating Streamflow, U.S. Geological Survey digital spatial data set, http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/metadata/usgswrd/XML/gagesII_Sept2011.xml. Falcone, J.A., 2015, U.S. conterminous wall-to-wall anthropogenic land use trends (NWALT), 1974-2012. U.S. Geological Survey Data Series 948, 33 p. plus appendices 3-6 as separate files, http://dx.doi.org/10.3133/ds948. Falcone, J.A., 2016, Mapping enhanced grazing potential based on the NAWQA Wall-to-wall Anthropogenic Land-use Trends (NWALT) product, 1974-2012: U.S. Geological Survey data release, http://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7CR5RFF. Fry, J., Xian, G., Jin, S., Dewitz, J., Homer, C., Yang, L., Barnes, C., Herold, N., and Wickham, J., 2011, Completion of the 2006 National Land Cover Database for the Conterminous United States, Photogrammetric Engineering and Remote Sensing, Vol. 77(9):858-864. Homer, C., Dewitz, J., Fry, J., Coan, M., Hossain, N., Larson, C., Herold, N., McKerrow, A., VanDriel, J.N., and Wickham, J., 2007, Completion of the 2001 National Land Cover Database for the Conterminous United States, Photogrammetric Engineering and Remote Sensing, Vol. 73, No. 4, pp 337-341. Homer, C.G., Dewitz, J.A., Yang, L., Jin, S., Danielson, P., Xian, G., Coulston, J., Herold, N.D., Wickham, J.D., and Megown, K., 2015, Completion of the 2011 National Land Cover Database for the conterminous United States-Representing a decade of land cover change information. Photogrammetric Engineering and Remote Sensing, v. 81, no. 5, p. 345-354.

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.

attracc.attraccr: Values were spot checked against source data.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

citeinfo.title: GAGES-II: Geospatial Attributes of Gages for Evaluating Streamflow

srcinfo.srccontr: Sites for which these data provide updated data.
NLCD 2001 dataset from which 2001 land cover/use was derived
NLCD 2006 dataset from which 2006 land cover/use was derived
NLCD 2011 dataset from which 2011 land cover/use was derived

citeinfo.title: Mapping enhanced grazing potential based on the NAWQA Wall-to-wall Anthropogenic Landuse Trends (NWALT) product, 1974-2012

srcinfo.srccontr: Source dataset from which land use for 1974-2012 were derived

procstep.procdesc: (1) Source data for the NLCD were downloaded (https://www.mrlc.gov/) and converted to grid format in March 2015. The source data for the NLCD are the October 2014 normalized version of data, where all years have been adjusted to agree with one another.
(2) Source data for the NWALT from Falcone, 2016. See Falcone, 2015 for most complete description of product.
(3) Category percentages were calculated from these sources.

detailed.Name: LandUse_NLCD_2001.txt, LandUse_NLCD_2006.txt, LandUse_NLCD_2011.txt, LandUse_NWALT_1974.txt, LandUse_NWALT_1982.txt, LandUse_NWALT_1992.txt, LandUse_NWALT_2002.txt, LandUse_NWALT_2012.txt

enttyp.enttypl: Attribute Table for land use information, tables LandUse_NLCD_2001.txt, LandUse_NLCD_2006.txt, LandUse_NLCD_2011.txt, LandUse_NWALT_1974.txt, LandUse_NWALT_1982.txt, LandUse_NWALT_1992.txt, LandUse_NWALT_2002.txt, LandUse_NWALT_2012.txt
enttyp.enttypd: Data consist of eight comma-separated text files, three for NLCD (2001, 2006, 2011), and five for NWALT (1974, 1982, 1992, 2002, 2012)

attr.attrdef: Unique station identification number
attr.attrdefs: Corresponds to unique station identifier in GAGES-II

The act of distribution shall not constitute any such warranty, and no responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of this data, software, or related materials. Any use of trade, product, or firm names is for descriptive purposes only and does not imply endorsement by the U.S. Government.
